text message: It is great that you are praising your child for things they do well. As you appreciate them, they will also start appreciating you and the others in your family more – you set the best example!

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: We all sometimes feel like our children are causing more negativity than positivity. Try to see through negative attitudes and praise any positive behaviour you notice. With time, you will see the change!

text message: Sorry that it has been harder for you to praise your child. Try to find something positive, even if it is small. Over time, they will appreciate that you notice when they do something well.

text message: I understand it can be hard to praise your child sometimes. Remember, your praise makes a big difference, even if you don’t see it right away!

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Sometime our children don’t seem to do or say many things that deserve praise. Start praising the small things, you will see your child showing more positive behaviour over time!

text message: Well done for praising your child. Praise will help your child feel good about themselves, and they will show even more positive behaviour!

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: With everything that is going on, it is not always easy to focus on the positive. Try to find 10 minutes to pay attention to what your child is doing – perhaps you can praise them for helping with a chore or for doing their homework? It helps a lot!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

text message: Being a mother is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Being the man of the house is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Being a parent is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: It can be difficult to control our anger, especially when they make us really angry. Take a deep breath, and be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Sorry that you are having a difficult time with your child. It happens to all of us. Remember, we can choose to behave differently next time.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Well done! Brain science shows if you control your anger when your child misbehaves, you increase your child's brain development. Be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Great work! When we respond calmly, our teens are more likely to do the same.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Our children can really drive us crazy sometimes. By responding calmly, they will learn to do the same when something upsets them at home or outside. Your patience will pay off, you will see!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Well done for keeping calm in difficult situations – that is definitely not easy to do! You are setting a great example for your child.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: We all get overwhelmed sometimes. Next time when you feel angry, try taking a deep breath before responding. This helps a lot!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: When we get angry, it can be hard to stay calm. Try to recognise your emotions and those of your child, and talk about them later - this helps everyone to understand each other better next time. You can do it!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: It is great that you can address your child more and more calmly when they upset you. Working through challenges together will help your child so much in life – you are doing amazing!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: So good that you speak to your child calmly, even when they drive you crazy. You should be proud of yourself! Remember to keep taking deep breaths every time you feel they are testing your patience.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Wonderful to hear that you are managing to stay calm in difficult situations. You should be proud of yourself – keep up the great work!

text message: Sorry that things are not always easy with your child. When they upset you, try to remain calm, That way, you can keep clear boundaries and solve problems together. You can do it!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message:
It can sometimes be difficult to have a positive relationship with our children. How confident do you feel about your ability as a parent/caregiver to have a positive relationship with your children? (0=not confident to 7=extremely confident)

If you don't want to answer, please type 99.

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Having a positive relationship with our children can be difficult, especially during stressful times. You might want to try spending a little more One-on-One Time with your child. It will show them that they are valued and loved.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Sometimes it can be hard to know what to do to help keep our children safe. Talk to them and get advice from people you can trust, it really helps!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: So good to hear you are feeling more confident to keep your child safe! Remember, building a positive relationship with your child makes it easier to talk about difficult things, including potential risks. You are doing really well!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: It is hard to know how to keep our children safe, especially if they spend time online or outside the house. By spending time with our children, they will feel free to share with us if they have questions or problems.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: You are not alone! We are all trying to figure out how to best keep our children safe, and nobody has all the answers. We are here to help!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Talking about difficult things, including the risks of sexual abuse, can be really hard. Well done for making the effort to talk about these difficult topics and questions – it really helps to keep your child safe!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Keeping our children safe is not easy, but by working together we can prevent and prepare for so many things! Ask your children what risks they know of, and fill in any gaps together. You make an amazing team!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Great that you are learning more about how to keep your child safe. Nobody has all the answers, but it makes a big difference if you and your child can talk about difficult things together. Keep up the good work!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Well done for learning more about potential risks and how to protect your child. Knowledge is power – thank you for sharing that power with your child even it makes you feel uncomfortable sometimes!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Being a mother is not easy and comes with lots of stress and responsibilities. Well done for taking the time to learn how to keep your child safe!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Being the man of the house is not easy and comes with lots of stress and responsibilities. Well done for taking the time to learn how to keep your child safe!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Being a parent is not easy and comes with lots of stress and responsibilities. It can be difficult to know how to keep our children safe. We are here to support you!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Well done for learning more about how you can keep your child safe. It is not easy, but you are doing a great job – you should be proud of yourself!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Questions & Comparison
text message: Sometimes we can feel overwhelmed by the potential dangers around us. Talk to your children and people you can trust. Together we can come up with a plan to keep everyone safe – well done for putting in the work!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Parenting & Behaviour - Questions & Comparison

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: It can be exhausting when your children have too much energy or can't focus on one thing. Sometimes, your children need opportunities to be very active and run around to help them be calm afterwards.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Would you like suggestions for active and calm things to do with your child?
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night). It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Check to see why your baby is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for your baby when they are having a difficult day.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing your baby close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and your baby will get through it together!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Your baby will cry as soon as a caregiver’s attention is diverted and are cranky as well as clingy. Prioritise being there for them and give them physical contact when needed.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Pay close attention to your baby in case they try something dangerous! Just because they are able to play on their own now, doesn’t mean you can look away for long. Redirect mischievous behaviours into practice waving, imitation games, singing and moving games and pretending to talk on the phone!
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Try to stay calm and support your toddler as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to your child’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Babies are much more likely to want to do things if you make the activity fun and playful. Patience is also a must. Take a deep breath if you notice yourself getting frustrated by your baby.
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Would you like to learn more?
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Would you like to learn more?
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours

name: Tips for difficult behaviours
text message: Your baby or toddler may sometimes want something that they cannot have. If they start whining, first check to see if there is something wrong (are they actually hungry or tired)? If they continue, try to redirect their attention to something else. You should also try to ignore their behaviour while attending to them for comfort and support
name of flow: PLH - Survey - Behave - Tips for difficult behaviours
